sections.content: Australia's first specialist, standalone cardiac hospital has reached a major milestone this month, with major construction now complete by the builder, [John Holland](https://johnholland.com.au/).
The $577 million landmark facility will be operated by Monash Health, in partnership with Monash University. It is based in the heart of the Monash Technology Precinct in Clayton.

[The Victorian Heart Hospital](https://www.vhba.vic.gov.au/health/specialist-centres/victorian-heart-hospital) will house 206 beds and a suite of specialist facilities, including cardiac theatres and cardiac catheterisation laboratories.
